subSubSection.paragraph: Female. Morphologically similar to the male, except for the genital characters.

Material examined.
BRAZIL ,
Tocantins
, Porto Nacional , 10°42’12.4” S , 48°23’26.8” W ,
25.v.2005
, leg. Rodrigues F.M. ( 1♀ CEUFT ); Palmas , Vale do Vai Quem Quer , 10°23’38.9” S , 48°07’56.1” W ,
13-14.xi.2017
, leg. Krolow , T
.
K. e Equipe ( 5♀ , 4♂ CEUFT ); idem, 10°23’38.9” S , 48°07’56.1” W ,
04-07.xii.2018
, leg. Fernandes, A.S. e Equipe (33#, 24♂ CEUFT ); Pedro Afonso , Rio Sono , 8°58’58.5” S , 48°09’05.3” W ,
11-12.x.2018
, leg. Krolow , T
.
K. e Equipe ( 1♂ CEUFT )
;.

Distribution .
Argentina , Brazil : Amazonas, Pará, Tocantins ; French Guiana , Guyana , Mexico ?, Panama , Peru , Venezuela ( Heckman 2017 , Rafael & Câmara 2020 ).

caption.paragraph: TABLE 1 . Megaloptera species known from Brazil. (*) previous records based only on immatures.

subSubSection.paragraph:
AC = Acre , AM = Amazonas , AP
= Amapá , BA = Bahia , ES = Espírito Santo , GO =
Goiás , MG = Minas Gerais , MT = Mato Grosso , PA
= Pará, PR = Paraná , RS = Rio Grande do Sul , RO = Rondônia , RR = Roraima , SC = Santa Catarina , SP = São Paulo , TO = Tocantins .
